flawed_nl_solution:
Christina's age will be half of 80 in five years to come, meaning in five years, Christina's age will be 1/2*80=160/1 years.
If in five years Christina will be 160/1, currently she is 160/1-5=<<160/1-5=155>>155 years old.
Oscar will be 3/5 times as old as Christina is now in 15 years, meaning he will be 3/5*155=<<3/5*155=93>>93 years old in 15 years.
Currently, Oscar is 93-15=<<93-15=78>>78 years old.
#### 78

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 40, not 160/1. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
